results.title: Synthesis of an organic compound
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study”
Shows the synthesis of 2-butanone, a ketone, from 2-butanol, an alcohol, as an example of a common type of organic synthesis. Discusses three basic steps: synthesis, purification, identification. In the synthesis, 2-butanol is oxidised by sodium dichromate and sulphuric acid to yield 2-butanone. Purification is accomplished by solvent extraction, followed by distillation of the 2-butanone. The identity of the product is established by forming a solid derivative of the 2-butanone and determining its melting point, and is confirmed by infrared spectroscopy
results.creator_credit_for_label: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway and Wexler Film Productions

results.title: Molecular motions
results.creator_credit: Hal Geer and National Science Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Uses animation and models to explain how the properties of matter such as fluidity, vaporisation and rate of chemical reactions depend on the types of motion occurring at the molecular level.

results.title: Chemical bonding
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway, Davidson Films and National Science Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Explains chemical bonding in terms of electric interactions that cause the bonding in the hydrogen molecule. The release of energy when H atoms combine to form H2 on a platinum surface is shown. This energy change is related to the similtaneous attraction of electrons by two or more nuclei, opposed by electron-electron repulsions. Through animation the quantum mechanical view of electron distribution is portrayed. The bonding interaction between two hydrogen atoms is contrasted to the very weak, non-bonding interaction between two melium atoms. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway, Davidson Films and National Science Foundation

results.title: Gas pressure and molecular collisions
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Chemistry Educational Materials Study and Educational Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Explores the relationship between gaseous pressure and molecular collisions. Studies the effects of varying the number of molecules per unit of volume and of varying the temperature. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Shapes and polarities of molecules
results.creator_credit: National Science Foundation and Norman Wright Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Observations of electrical effects lead to the concept of molecular polarity. Covalent substances give two types of results: some show marked interactions with electric charges, others give little effect. A model is developed based on polar and non-polar molecules. The molecular dipole model is extended to explain differences in solubility, conductivity and chemical reactivity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: National Science Foundation and Norman Wright Productions

results.title: India: an Introduction
results.creator_credit: James MacDonald, Michael Camerini, Sam Bryan and Worldview Productions
results.brief_description: Shows India as a nation varied in cultures, religions and customs, in climate, dress, diet, history, and language. Looks at industries and farming. Animated maps are used to locate the Himalayas, farmlands, paths of the monsoon rains, population density and India’s many alphabets and languages.

results.title: Independent living centre [Turkish Version]
results.brief_description: Outlines the highly specialised and unique services of the Independent Living Centre in Victoria which aims to assist people with disabilities to enhance their independence and quality of life by providing demonstrations, advice and information on a comprehensive range of aids and equipment for daily living. Narrated in Turkish.
